description: Advanced layout techniques including asymmetry, overlap, diagonal flows, and grid-breaking

items.name: Asymmetric Two-Column Contrast
items.description: Unequal column widths creating dynamic visual balance (e.g., 30/70 or 40/60 split)
items.visualComposition: Small detailed content (text, list, metadata) + Large emphasis element (image, illustration, statement)
items.responsiveBehavior: Collapses to single column at breakpoint (< 768px typically), then stacks vertically maintaining visual emphasis

items.name: Overlapping Cards with Z-Index Layering
items.description: Multiple cards positioned with negative margins and z-index creating depth perception
items.gridBase: Absolute/relative positioning or CSS Grid with negative margins
items.visualComposition: 3-5 stacked cards with staggered positioning, each slightly offset horizontally and vertically
items.responsiveBehavior: Desktop: overlapped stacking. Tablet: reduced offset. Mobile: single column with cascading effect

items.name: Diagonal Flow with Transform Skew
items.description: Elements arranged along diagonal axis using skew transforms and rotations
items.gridBase: Combination of Grid, Flexbox, and CSS Transform
items.visualComposition: Elements positioned along 45-degree (or 30/60 degree) axis, creating dynamic non-orthogonal flow
items.responsiveBehavior: Reduces skew angles on mobile, uses simpler layout at smaller breakpoints, maintains diagonal visual concept

items.name: Grid Break-Out with Absolute Positioning
items.description: Container-constrained grid with elements breaking out of boundaries using absolute positioning
items.gridBase: CSS Grid parent with relative positioning + absolute child positioning
items.visualComposition: Regular grid with 1-2 large elements that extend beyond grid container boundaries, creating break-out visual effect
items.responsiveBehavior: Desktop: elements break out dynamically. Tablet: reduced breakout extent. Mobile: contained within bounds, layered stacking

items.name: Circular/Organic Grid Layout
items.description: Non-rectangular grid arrangement using radial positioning and organic shapes
items.gridBase: CSS Grid with radial positioning or absolute positioning in circular pattern
items.visualComposition: Central element with 4-8 surrounding elements arranged in circular pattern with optional varying sizes
items.responsiveBehavior: Scales down proportionally on mobile, may convert to linear stacking at breakpoints, maintains relative positioning

items.name: Masonry with Variable Heights
items.description: Irregular grid where items have varying heights creating interlocked visual pattern
items.gridBase: CSS Grid with auto-fit and row-span, or CSS Columns fallback
items.visualComposition: Cards of varying heights (single, double, or triple height) arranged in columns creating staggered, interlocked visual
items.responsiveBehavior: Desktop: 3-4 columns with variable heights. Tablet: 2 columns with reduced variation. Mobile: single column, variable heights maintained

items.name: Split-Screen with Scroll Offset
items.description: Two-column layout where right content scrolls at different rate creating parallax effect
items.gridBase: Flexbox or Grid with position: sticky and overflow handling
items.visualComposition: Equal or weighted columns with independent scroll behaviors creating depth and movement impression
items.responsiveBehavior: Desktop: side-by-side with independent scrolling. Tablet/Mobile: stacked vertically with synchronized scroll, parallax reduced or disabled
